p: ACE2 belongs to the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system (RAAS), which contributes to the pathophysiology of hypertension and cardiovascular/renal diseases by maintaining homeostasis of blood pressure, electrolyte balance and inflammatory responses ( Cava et al., 2020). ACE2 can be considered as a key counterregulatory enzyme that degrades angiotensin II to angiotensin-(1â€“7), which exerts vasodilatory, natriuretic/diuretic, anti-inflammatory, and antifibrotic effects via Mas receptor (MasR) ( Abasi et al., 2020; Vaduganathan et al., 2020).
